TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SignedXml extends System.Object

summary.span: 在核心 XML 签名对象上提供包装器，以便创建 XML 签名。

span.span: Provides a wrapper on a core XML signature object to facilitate creating XML signatures.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类是万维网联合会 (W3C) 的.NET 实现[XML 签名语法和处理规范](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/)，也称为 XMLDSIG （XML 数字签名）。The class is the .NET implementation of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/), also known as XMLDSIG (XML Digital Signature). XMLDSIG 是基于标准的、 可互操作的方式进行签名并验证所有或部分 XML 文档或可从统一资源标识符 (URI) 寻址的其他数据。XMLDSIG is a standards-based, interoperable way to sign and verify all or part of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 使用类无论何时需要共享签名 XML 数据应用程序或组织之间以标准方式。Use the class whenever you need to share signed XML data between applications or organizations in a standard way. 可以通过 XMLDSIG W3C 规范的任何一致性实现验证签名使用此类的任何数据。Any data signed using this class can be verified by any conforming implementation of the W3C specification for XMLDSIG. 类使您可以创建 XML 数字签名的以下三种：The class allows you to create the following three kinds of XML digital signatures: |签名类型Signature Type|描述Description| |--------------------|-----------------| |封装的签名Enveloped signature|签名包含在正被签名的 XML 元素。The signature is contained within the XML element being signed.| |包封签名Enveloping signature|签名的 XML 包含在``元素。The signed XML is contained within the `` element.| |内部分离的签名Internal detached signature|签名和签名的 XML 是在同一文档中，但两个元素中包含其他。The signature and signed XML are in the same document, but neither element contains the other.| 此外，还有第四种调用时的数据和签名是在单独的 XML 文档中的外部分离的签名的签名。There is also a fourth kind of signature called an external detached signature which is when the data and signature are in separate XML documents. 不支持外部分离的签名类。External detached signatures are not supported by the class. ## XML 签名的结构The structure of an XML Signature XMLDSIG 创建``元素，它包含的数字签名的 XML 文档或其他可从 URI 寻址的数据。XMLDSIG creates a `` element, which contains a digital signature of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a URI. ``元素可以选择包含有关在何处可以找到将验证此签名的密钥信息和哪种加密算法用于签名。The `` element can optionally contain information about where to find a key that will verify the signature and which cryptographic algorithm was used for signing. 基本结构是按如下所示：The basic structure is as follows: ```xml Base64EncodedValue== AnotherBase64EncodedValue=== ``` 此结构的主要部分是：The main parts of this structure are: - `` 元素The `` element 指定用于重写规则`Signature`从 XML/文本元素插入签名验证的字节数。Specifies the rules for rewriting the `Signature` element from XML/text into bytes for signature validation. 在.NET 中的默认值是，用于标识可信的算法。The default value in .NET is , which identifies a trustworthy algorithm. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. - `` 元素The `` element 指定用于签名生成和验证，已应用到的算法``元素以生成中的值``。Specifies the algorithm used for signature generation and validation, which was applied to the `` element to produce the value in ``. 在上一示例中，值标识的 RSA PKCS1 sha-1 签名。In the previous example, the value identifies an RSA PKCS1 SHA-1 signature. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. - `` 元素The `` element 指定的加密签名``元素。Specifies the cryptographic signature for the `` element. 如果此签名不验证，然后的某些部分``块已被篡改，并且该文档将被视为无效。If this signature does not verify, then some portion of the `` block was tampered with, and the document is considered invalid. 只要``值是可信任，则该值为有效防止篡改。As long as the `` value is trustworthy, this value is highly resistant to tampering. 此元素表示由属性。This element is represented by the property. - `URI`属性的``元素The `URI` attribute of the `` element 指定使用的 URI 引用的数据对象。Specifies a data object using a URI reference. 此属性由属性。This attribute is represented by the property. - 未指定`URI`属性，即，设置属性设置为`null`，意味着接收应用程序需要知道对象的标识。Not specifying the `URI` attribute, that is, setting the property to `null`, means that the receiving application is expected to know the identity of the object. 在大多数情况下， `null` URI 会导致引发异常。In most cases, a `null` URI will result in an exception being thrown. 不要使用`null`URI，除非你的应用程序进行交互操作与需要它的协议。Do not use a `null` URI, unless your application is interoperating with a protocol which requires it. - 设置`URI`属性为空字符串指示，该文档的根元素正进行签名，被包封签名的一种形式。Setting the `URI` attribute to an empty string indicates that the root element of the document is being signed, a form of enveloped signature. - 如果的值`URI`属性开头 #，则值必须解析为当前文档中的元素。If the value of `URI` attribute starts with #, then the value must resolve to an element in the current document. 此窗体可用于任何受支持的签名类型 （被包封签名、 包封签名或内部分离的签名）。This form can be used with any of the supported signature types (enveloped signature, enveloping signature or internal detached signature). - 任何其他内容被视为外部资源拆离签名和不受类。Anything else is considered an external resource detached signature and is not supported by the class. - `` 元素The `` element 包含的排序的列表``描述如何签名者获取的数据对象的元素融会贯通。Contains an ordered list of `` elements that describe how the signer obtained the data object that was digested. 转换算法是类似于规范化方法，但无需重写``元素，它将重写由标识的内容`URI`属性的``元素。A transform algorithm is similar to the canonicalization method, but instead of rewriting the `` element, it rewrites the content identified by the `URI` attribute of the `` element. ``元素表示由类。The `` element is represented by the class. - 每个转换算法定义为采用 XML (一个 XPath 节点集) 或字节数作为输入。Each transform algorithm is defined as taking either XML (an XPath node-set) or bytes as input. 如果当前数据的格式不同于转换的输入要求，应用转换规则。If the format of the current data differs from the transform input requirements, conversion rules are applied. - 每个转换算法被定义为作为输出生成 XML 或字节数。Each transform algorithm is defined as producing either XML or bytes as the output. - 如果以字节为单位未定义的最后一个转换算法的输出 （或指定不转换），则[规范化方法](https://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315)用作隐式转换 (即使中指定了不同的算法``元素)。If the output of the last transform algorithm is not defined in bytes (or no transforms were specified), then the [canonicalization method](https://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315) is used as an implicit transform (even if a different algorithm was specified in the `` element). - 值为转换算法进行编码的规则将被解释为删除``从文档元素。A value of for the transform algorithm encodes a rule which is interpreted as remove the `` element from the document. 否则为被包封签名的验证程序将摘要式文档，包括签名，但签名人会有融会贯通文档之前应用签名，从而导致不同的答案。Otherwise, a verifier of an enveloped signature will digest the document, including the signature, but the signer would have digested the document before the signature was applied, leading to different answers. - `` 元素The `` element 标识要在转换后的内容由标识应用的摘要 （加密哈希） 方法`URI`属性的``元素。Identifies the digest (cryptographic hash) method to apply on the transformed content identified by the `URI` attribute of the `` element. 这由属性。This is represented by the property. ## 选择规范化方法Choosing a canonicalization method 除非需要使用不同的值的规范与进行互操作，否则我们建议使用默认.NET 规范化方法，这是 XML C14N 1.0 算法，其值是。Unless interoperating with a specification which requires the use of a different value, we recommend that you use the default .NET canonicalization method, which is the XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm, whose value is . XML C14N 1.0 算法需要支持的所有实现的 XMLDSIG，特别是因为它是隐式的最后一个转换以将应用。The XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm is required to be supported by all implementations of XMLDSIG, particularly as it is an implicit final transform to apply. 有版本支持保留注释规范化算法。There are versions of canonicalization algorithms which support preserving comments. 不建议保留注释的规范化方法，因为他们违反"签名所看到的内容"原则。Comment-preserving canonicalization methods are not recommended because they violate the "sign what is seen" principle. 也就是说中的注释``元素不会更改处理逻辑的签名的执行方式，只是哪些签名值。That is, the comments in a `` element will not alter the processing logic for how the signature is performed, merely what the signature value is. 与弱签名算法，从而为包含的提供的注释允许攻击者不必要可以自由地强制执行哈希冲突，结合使用时进行篡改的文档显示合法。When combined with a weak signature algorithm, allowing the comments to be included gives an attacker unnecessary freedom to force a hash collision, making a tampered document appear legitimate. 在.NET Framework 中，默认情况下支持仅内置 canonicalizers。In the .NET Framework, only built-in canonicalizers are supported by default. 若要支持其他或自定义 canonicalizers，请参阅属性。To support additional or custom canonicalizers, see the property. 如果文档是否使用不是由表示集合中的规范化方法属性，则方法将返回`false`。If the document uses a canonicalization method that is not in the collection represented by the property, then the method will return `false`. > [!NOTE] > 极防御性的应用程序可以删除不需要签名者中要使用的任何值集合。An extremely defensive application can remove any values it does not expect signers to use from the collection. ## 是引用值被篡改安全？Are the Reference values safe from tampering? 是的``值是安全被篡改。Yes, the `` values are safe from tampering. .NET 验证``计算之前处理的任何``值和其关联转换，并将提前中止以避免潜在的恶意的处理指令。.NET verifies the `` computation before processing any of the `` values and their associated transforms, and will abort early to avoid potentially malicious processing instructions. ## 选择要签名的元素Choosing the elements to sign 我们建议你使用的值""对于`URI`属性 (或设置属性为空字符串)，在可能的情况。We recommend that you use the value of "" for the `URI` attribute (or set the property to an empty string), if possible. 这意味着整个文档视为摘要计算，这意味着整个文档保护不被篡改。This means the whole document is considered for the digest computation, which means the whole document is protected from tampering. 它是很常见，若要查看`URI`如 #foo，其 ID 属性为"foo"的元素引用的定位点的窗体中的值。It is very common to see `URI` values in the form of anchors such as #foo, referring to an element whose ID attribute is "foo". 遗憾的是，很容易使此选项会被篡改，因为其中包括仅目标元素，而不是用上下文的内容。Unfortunately, it is easy for this to be tampered with because this includes only the content of the target element, not the context. 滥用这一区别就是通常作为 XML 签名包装 (XSW)。Abusing this distinction is known as XML Signature Wrapping (XSW). 如果你的应用程序认为注释，以进行语义 （这不常见时处理 XML），则应使用"#xpointer(/)"而不是""，并"#xpointer(id('foo'))"而不是"#foo"。If your application considers comments to be semantic (which is not common when dealing with XML), then you should use "#xpointer(/)" instead of "", and "#xpointer(id('foo'))" instead of "#foo". #Xpointer 版本被解释为包括注释，而为短名称为窗体将不包括注释。The #xpointer versions are interpreted as including comments, while the shortname forms are excluding comments. 如果您需要接受仅部分受保护的文档，并且你想要确保您阅读的内容相同的受保护的签名，请使用方法。If you need to accept documents which are only partially protected and you want to ensure that you are reading the same content that the signature protected, use the method. ## 有关 KeyInfo 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the KeyInfo element 在可选的数据``元素 (即，属性)，其中包含的密钥来验证签名，不应为受信任。The data in the optional `` element (that is, the property), which contains a key to validate the signature, should not be trusted. 特别地，当值表示裸机 RSA、 DSA 或 ECDSA 公钥，该文档可能已被篡改，尽管报告该签名有效的方法。In particular, when the value represents a bare RSA, DSA or ECDSA public key, the document could have been tampered with, despite the method reporting that the signature is valid. 这可能是因为执行被篡改的只该实体必须生成新密钥并使用该新密钥重新签名被篡改的文档。This can happen because the entity doing the tampering just has to generate a new key and re-sign the tampered document with that new key. 因此，除非你的应用程序验证的公钥为预期值，就像它已篡改应被视为文档。So, unless your application verifies that the public key is an expected value, the document should be treated as if it were tampered with. 这需要你的应用程序检查文档中嵌入的公钥，并验证其与文档上下文的已知值的列表。This requires that your application examine the public key embedded within the document and verify it against a list of known values for the document context. 例如，如果文档无法理解颁发者已知用户，会检查针对的用户所使用的已知键列表的键。For example, if the document could be understood to be issued by a known user, you'd check the key against a list of known keys used by that user. 你还可以使用来处理该文档后验证密钥方法，而不是使用方法。You can also verify the key after processing the document by using the method, instead of using the method. 但是，为获得最佳安全性，您应验证的密钥事先。But, for the optimal security, you should verify the key beforehand. 或者，请考虑尝试用户的注册公共密钥，而不是读取新增``元素。Alternately, consider trying the user's registered public keys, rather than reading what's in the `` element. ## 有关 X509Data 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the X509Data element 可选``元素是子元素的``元素且包含一个或多个 X509 证书或标识符的 X509 证书。The optional `` element is a child of the `` element and contains one or more X509 certificates or identifiers for X509 certificates. 中的数据``元素也不应继承方式受到信任。The data in the `` element should also not be inherently trusted. 验证具有嵌入的文档时``元素中，.NET 仅验证数据解析为 X509 证书可以成功使用其公钥来验证文档签名。When verifying a document with the embedded `` element, .NET verifies only that the data resolves to an X509 certificate whose public key can be successfully used to validate the document signature. 与调用不同方法替换`verifySignatureOnly`参数设置为`false`、 执行不进行吊销检查、 检查没有链信任关系，和验证不会过期。Unlike calling the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, no revocation check is performed, no chain trust is checked, and no expiration is verified. 即使你的应用程序提取证书本身，并将其传递给方法替换`verifySignatureOnly`参数设置为`false`，它仍不充分的验证，以防止文档被篡改。Even if your application extracts the certificate itself and passes it to the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, that is still not sufficient validation to prevent document tampering. 仍需要为适用于正被签名的文档验证该证书。The certificate still needs to be verified as being appropriate for the document being signed. 使用嵌入的签名证书可以是否提供有用的密钥轮换策略，在``部分或在文档内容中。Using an embedded signing certificate can provide useful key rotation strategies, whether in the `` section or in the document content. 使用此方法时应用程序应手动提取证书，并执行验证类似于：When using this approach an application should extract the certificate manually and perform validation similar to: - 证书已颁发直接或通过链由证书颁发机构 (CA) 的公共证书嵌入到应用程序。The certificate was issued directly or via a chain by a Certificate Authority (CA) whose public certificate is embedded in the application. 使用 OS 提供信任列表，无需进行其他检查，例如已知的使用者名称，并不足以防止篡改的。Using the OS-provided trust list without additional checks, such as a known subject name, is not sufficient to prevent tampering in . - 验证该证书尚未过期的文档签名时 （或"立即"的近乎实时的文档处理）。The certificate is verified to have not been expired at the time of document signing (or "now" for near real-time document processing). - 它支持吊销特定 CA 颁发的生存期较长的证书，验证未吊销该证书。For long-lived certificates issued by a CA which supports revocation, verify the certificate was not revoked. - 证书使用者验证为适用于当前文档中。The certificate subject is verified as being appropriate to the current document. ## 选择转换算法Choosing the transform algorithm 如果进行互操作使用的具有指定特定值 （如 XrML) 规范，然后您需要遵循规范。If you are interoperating with a specification which has dictated specific values (such as XrML), then you need to follow the specification. 如果必须被包封的签名 (例如，当对整个文档的签名)，则需要使用(由类)。If you have an enveloped signature (such as when signing the whole document), then you need to use (represented by the class). 您可以指定隐式的 XML C14N 转换，但不需要。You can specify the implicit XML-C14N transform as well, but it's not necessary. 对于在封装或已分离签名，没有转换是必需的。For an enveloping or detached signature, no transforms are required. 隐式的 XML C14N 转换负责的所有内容。The implicit XML-C14N transform takes care of everything. 与安全更新引起[Microsoft 安全公告 MS16-035](https://docs.microsoft.com/security-updates/securitybulletins/2016/ms16-035)，.NET 已限制转换可以是在文档验证中使用默认情况下，使用不受信任的转换导致始终返回`false`。With the security updated introduced by the [Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-035](https://docs.microsoft.com/security-updates/securitybulletins/2016/ms16-035), .NET has restricted what transforms can be used in document verification by default, with untrusted transforms causing to always return `false`. 具体而言，这需要额外的输入 （指定为 XML 中的子元素） 的转换，不再允许使用由于其滥用的可能性被恶意用户。In particular, transforms which require additional input (specified as child elements in the XML) are no longer allowed due to their susceptibility of abuse by malicious users. W3C 建议避免 XPath 和 XSLT 转换，都受到这些限制的两个主要转换。The W3C advises avoiding the XPath and XSLT transforms, which are the two main transforms affected by these restrictions. ## 使用外部引用问题The problem with external references 如果应用程序不会验证外部引用都不适合于当前上下文，它们可能会被滥用中提供的很多安全漏洞 （包括拒绝的服务，反射的分布式拒绝服务，信息的方式泄露、 签名跳过和远程执行代码）。If an application does not verify that external references seem appropriate for the current context, they can be abused in ways that provide for many security vulnerabilities (including Denial of Service, Distributed Reflection Denial of Service, Information Disclosure, Signature Bypass, and Remote Code Execution). 即使应用程序来验证外部引用 URI，仍两次加载资源的问题： 一旦您的应用程序时读取它，并后时读取它。Even if an application were to validate the external reference URI, there would remain a problem of the resource being loaded twice: once when your application reads it, and once when reads it. 由于没有应用程序读取和文档验证步骤具有相同的内容不能保证，签名不提供可信赖性。Since there's no guarantee that the application read and document verify steps have the same content, the signature does not provide trustworthiness. 给定的外部引用，风险遇到的外部引用时将引发异常。Given the risks of external references, will throw an exception when an external reference is encountered. 有关此问题的详细信息，请参阅[知识库文章 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3148821)。For more information about this issue, see [KB article 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3148821). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何进行签名和验证使用被包封的签名的整个 XML 文档。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/CPP/exampleenvelope.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/CS/exampleenvelope.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/VB/exampleenvelope.vb#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何进行签名和验证使用包封签名的 XML 文档的单一元素。The following code example shows how to sign and verify a single element of an XML document using an enveloping signature. [!code-cpp[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/CPP/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/CS/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/VB/sample.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在.NET framework 版本 1.1 中，未验证的 X.509 证书。In version 1.1 of the .NET Framework, the X.509 certificate is not verified. 在版本 2.0 及更高版本中，验证 X.509 证书。In version 2.0 and later, the X.509 certificate is verified. 在版本 2.0 及更高版本的.NET Framework 中，方法将适用于验证的证书"通讯簿"应用商店中搜索。In version 2.0 and later of the .NET Framework, the method will search the "AddressBook" store for certificates suitable for the verification. 例如，如果证书引用由使用者密钥标识符 (SKI)，方法将选择具有此 SKI 证书并将尝试一个接一个直到它可以验证的证书。For example, if the certificate is referenced by a Subject Key Identifier (SKI), the method will select certificates with this SKI and try them one after another until it can verify the certificate. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用从证书存储的 X.509 证书进行签名和验证 XML 文档。The following code example uses an X.509 certificate from a certificate store to sign and verify an XML document. remarks.format: ## Remarks 类解析由统一资源标识符 (URI) 命名的外部 XML 资源。The class resolves external XML resources named by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 如果不信任的 XML 文件的源，可能不想要允许访问由 URI 命名的计算机资源的 XML 文件。If you do not trust the source of the XML file, you might not want to allow the XML file to access computer resources named by the URI. 可以使用属性控制的 XML 文件必须通过指定不同的计算机资源的访问级别对象。You can use the property to control the level of access that XML files have to computer resources by specifying different objects. 如果您不想要允许任何访问权限，可以将此属性设置为`null`(`Nothing`在 Visual Basic 中)。If you do not want to allow any access, you can set this property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以使用此方法，以确保使用了仅某些转换，或签名使用某些哈希算法和等等。This method can be used to ensure that only certain transforms are used, or that the signature uses a certain hash algorithm, and so on. 将属性设置为`null`删除所有签名格式验证从对象。Setting the property to `null` removes all signature format validation from the object. 如果你想，还可以读取该对象的当前委托和它的链。You can also read the object's current delegate and chain to it if you want. 如果您设置了格式验证器，您提供的委托将收到作为输入参数对象正在验证并返回一个布尔值-`true`的格式是可接受的如果`false`如果不是。If you are setting up a format validator, the delegate you supply will receive as an input parameter the object being verified and returns a Boolean value - `true` if the format is acceptable, `false` if it is not. 如果在委托返回`false`出于任何原因对象将报告 XML 签名无效。If the delegate returns `false` for any reason, the object will report that the XML signature is not valid.
